snippet: As Senators Kirsten Gillibrand and Claire McCaskill mount fierce separate campaigns, the conflict has created an uncomfortable division between the Senate’s women.
abstract: Sens Kirsten E Gillibrand of New York and Claire McCaskill of Missouri mount fierce separate legislative campaigns for Pentagon policy bill that would make significant changes to how military deals with sexual assault; competing proposals, which differ over whether sexual assault cases should be tried outside military, has created uncomfortable division between female Senators.
lead_paragraph: As Senators Kirsten Gillibrand and Claire McCaskill mount fierce separate campaigns, the conflict has created an uncomfortable division between the Senate’s women.

headline.main: 2 Democrats Split on Tactics to Fight Military Sex Assaults
headline.print_headline: 2 Democrats Split on Tactics To Fight Military Sex Assaults

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
